intro: Passiflora calicicalyx, commonly known as the cup-shaped passionflower, is a climbing vine native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its unique, intricate flowers that feature a crown of filaments and a central cluster of stamens. The plant produces edible, orange-yellow berries that are rich in nutrients and have a tangy flavor. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped with a smooth or slightly lobed margin. Passiflora calicicalyx thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its striking floral display.
